article.description: Artie Bowers hit a 3-pointer with 31 seconds to play Saturday to give Massachusetts a 66-65 win over Temple, denying Hall of Fame coach John Chaney his 700th career victory.
article.headline: Minutemen grab first conference win
article.linkText: UMass denies Temple's Chaney his 700th victory
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. (AP) -- Artie Bowers hit a 3-pointer with 31 seconds to play Saturday to give Massachusetts a 66-65 win over Temple, denying Hall of Fame coach John Chaney his 700th career victory. UMass (6-11, 1-5 Atlantic 10), which had lost seven straight games, blew a 23-point lead in the second half and fell behind 65-62 with 1:32 to play. Temple (6-9, 1-4) trailed 39-22 at halftime before staging runs of 18-2 and 11-0 to go ahead. David Hawkins had 22 points after scoring only three in the first half. Mardy Collins added 16 for the Owls. Bowers went 7-for-11 from the field and led UMass with 19 points, while Rashaun Freeman had 16 points and Anthony Anderson added 12. Except for a 4-2 deficit at the start, UMass had things all its own way in the first half. Consecutive 3-pointers by Brennan Martin put the Minutemen in front 21-9 after 10 minutes. The Minutemen, who led 39-17 with 1:10 to play in the first half, shot 63.6 percent from the field in the opening 20 minutes. Temple shot 24.3 percent in the first half, with Hawkins, who averages 23 points, getting only one field goal.
